summary: This is an email chain from February 6, 2020, regarding a French journalist's inquiry about the Epstein case and international justice cooperation between the US and France. The journalist, Philippe Berry, seeks background information for a story, and the email is forwarded among recipients for handling.

persons.name: Philippe Berry
persons.context: US correspondent for French newspaper 20 Minutes, contacting someone to ask questions about the Epstein case and US/French judicial cooperation for a story.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Addressed in the email forwarding chain, likely a colleague or contact being asked to handle the journalist's inquiry.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry on Epstein Case
events.description: Philippe Berry, a French journalist, sends an email seeking information about the Epstein case and how US/French judicial authorities cooperate in international cases.

keyFacts: A French journalist from 20 Minutes newspaper contacted a US-based individual (likely a legal professional or academic) in February 2020 seeking background on the Epstein case and international judicial cooperation.
The journalist's inquiry indicates ongoing media interest in the Epstein case and its cross-border legal aspects in early 2020.
The email chain shows internal forwarding and coordination about how to handle the media inquiry, with one recipient noting they were contacted via a law school email address they didn't appreciate.
